interface.name: org.alljoyn.Bus.Security2.ApplicationState
interface.description: The interface provided by all security 2.0 applications for discovery purposes.

struct.name: PublicKey
struct.description: A struct providing the details of an Elliptic Curve public key.

field.name: algorithm
field.description: An enumeration describing the key type: 0: ECDSA with SHA256

field.name: curveIdentifier
field.description: An Enumeration identifying the curve this key is using. 0: NIST P-256

field.name: xCoordinate
field.description: The X coordinate of the public key.

field.name: yCoordinate
field.description: The Y coordinate of the public key.

signal.name: State
signal.description: The State signal is used to advertise the state of an application. It is sessionless, because the signal is intended to discover the applications.

arg.name: publicKey
arg.description: The public key used by this application to identify itself

arg.name: claimableState
arg.description: An enumeration representing the current state of the application. Values: 0: Not claimable. The application is not claimed and not accepting claim request. 1: Claimable. The application is not claimed, but is accepting claim request. 2: Claimed. The application is claimed and can be configured. 3: Update. The application is claimed, but requires a configuration update (after a software upgrade)
